s0508.literal: Xiang Yu knew himself to have few allies and exhausted provisions; Han Xin moreover advanced troops to attack Chu, and Yu was troubled by it.
s0508.idiomatic: Xiang Yu realized he had few allies remaining and his supplies were depleted; moreover, Han Xin advanced his troops to attack Chu, filling Yu with concern.

s0509.literal: Han dispatched Lu Jia to persuade Yu, requesting Taigong, but Yu did not listen.
s0509.idiomatic: Han sent Lu Jia to negotiate with Yu and request the return of Taigong, but Yu refused to listen.

s0510.literal: Han again sent Hou Gong to persuade Yu, and Yu then made a pact with Han, dividing the world in the middle, allotting Honggou west to Han and east to Chu.
s0510.idiomatic: Han sent Hou Gong once more to persuade Yu, whereupon Yu agreed to a treaty with Han, dividing the realm equally along the Honggou Riverâ€”west to Han, east to Chu.
